page.title: 15LIPWOOD HALL, HAYDON BRIDGE.
page.content: This is the only{stately home}in this block. It was built in the 19th.century. It is owned by{Lord & {Lady Elliott.}It is built of sandstone from a nearby quarry but like many houses in the area has hard (limestone?)corner blocks. It is slate roofed but stone flags remain on part of it. Special features include a curved section of exterior wall, an imposing entrance hall,wood-lined, like the dining-room. Even the stables are wood-lined. A Victorian bath-room survives as does a kitchen garden, now laid-out with flowers & shrubs. The house retains fine beech trees in a small park, a stable cottage & a coach house.{Whinnetley Farm}was once its Home Farm. At both Whinnetley & Lipwood Hall are the remains of older houses.
